column1: A simian crease is a single line that runs across the palm of the hand.
Palmar creases develop while a baby is growing in the womb, usually by the 12th week of gestation.
An infant with a single palmar crease may have other symptoms and signs that, when taken together, define a specific syndrome or condition.
Your health care provider may ask questions such as: - Is there a family history of Down syndrome or other disorder associated with a single palmar crease?
